cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 120 miles SE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving west tonight, then west-northwest Friday and turning northwest toward the central Louisiana coast by late Friday/early Saturday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City–Intracoastal City

weather_observation.under_watch: Hurricane Watch (also under Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Cameron, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect as of Advisory #3
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast including all of Louisiana and portions of Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–63 kt) possible by late Friday night with a 38 % cumulative chance; hurricane-force winds remain unlikely (<2 %).
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–6 ft inundation possible from the mouth of the Pearl River westward to Intracoastal City, including areas adjacent to the Port of South Louisiana.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches possible near and inland of the central Gulf Coast with isolated totals to 20 inches – very heavy rain already ongoing around New Orleans–Baton Rouge corridor.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Fresh-water flooding of the Mississippi River and its tributaries, reduced visibility, possible closure of navigation channels and terminals due to high water and surge.
